Senate File 110 - Introduced


                                 SENATE FILE 

                                 SENATE FILE 
                                 SENATE FILE                                  SENATE FILE                                  BY  BOLKCOM

 A BILL FOR

  1 An Act providing for a state assessment for water quality and
  2    soil conservation imposed on agricultural commodities,
  3    including establishing procedures for referendums to
  4    establish, continue, or terminate the state assessment, the
  5    transfer of moneys to the department of agriculture and land
  6    stewardship, and the appropriation of moneys.
  7 BE IT ENACTED BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF THE STATE OF IOWA:
    TLSB 1401XS (24) 87
    da/rj

PAG LIN

  1  2               IOWA DAIRY INDUSTRY COMMISSION AND
  1  3                  IOWA STATE DAIRY ASSOCIATION
  1  4    Section 1.  Section 179.1, Code 2017, is amended by adding
  1  5 the following new subsections:
  1  6

 10 15     10 14 chapter.
 10 15     10 15     10 16 time after the  10 17 and shall  10 18 receiving a petition 10 19 percent or more of the number of producers eligible to vote,
 10 20 to determine whether the producers favor the  10 20 to determine whether the producers favor the  10 21  suspension  10 22 for direct use 10 23  10 24 use no later than 10 25 that suspension or termination of the  10 26 assessment 10 27 in the  10 28  10 29 practicable after the determination.
 10 30    Sec. 12.   10 30    Sec. 12.   10 31 questions ==== establishment, increase, or termination of a state
 10 32 assessment.
 10 33    1.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is established,
 10 34 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 10 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct
 11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,
 12  3 a separate special question whether to establish a state
 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.
 12  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 12  9 this subsection or include the special question as part of a
 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  10 32 assessment.
 10 33    1.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is established,
 10 34 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 10 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct
 11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.

 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.

 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  10 34 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 10 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct
 11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,

 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.

 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  10 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct
 11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,
 12  3 a separate special question whether to establish a state
 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.
 12  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 12  9 this subsection or include the special question as part of a
 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct
 11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of

 12 25 conducted.

 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is

 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum

 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  2 a special referendum to determine whether to establish a state
 11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum

 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.

 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.

 12 25 conducted.

 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary

 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and

 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on

 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment

 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  3 assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,
 12  3 a separate special question whether to establish a state
 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.
 12  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 12  9 this subsection or include the special question as part of a
 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  4    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11  5 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,
 12  3 a separate special question whether to establish a state
 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.
 12  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 12  9 this subsection or include the special question as part of a
 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II

 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.

 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for

 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  6 under section 179.13, the secretary shall include as part of
 11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of

 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil

 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or

 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  7 the initial referendum conducted pursuant to section 179.13,
 11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.

 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,

 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the

 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.

 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of

 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum

 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  11  8 subsection 1, a separate special question whether to establish
 11  9 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if
 11 10 the secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 11 11 is cost=effective or the petition demands inclusion.
 11 12    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum
 11 13 under this subsection or include the separate special question
 11 14 as part of an initial or special referendum conducted under
 11 15 section 179.13, subsection 1, in consultation with the
 11 16 commission and which may be based on the same procedures for
 11 17 conducting an initial referendum under section 179.13.
 11 18    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 11 19 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 11 20 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 11 21 referendum under this subsection or in an initial referendum
 11 22 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 1, that includes
 11 23 a special question as provided in paragraph "b", the state
 11 24 assessment shall commence on a date determined by the secretary
 11 25 after consultation with the commission but not later than six
 11 26 months after the date that the special or initial referendum
 11 27 was conducted.
 11 28    2.  a.  If a national assessment is being collected, and upon
 11 29 receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise complies with
 11 30 requirements to conduct an initial referendum under section
 11 31 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall conduct a special
 11 32 referendum to determine whether to establish a state assessment
 11 33 for water quality and soil conservation.
 11 34    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 11 35 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12  1 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 12  2 as part of the referendum to establish a national assessment,
 12  3 a separate special question whether to establish a state
 12  4 assessment for water quality and soil conservation, if the
 12  5 secretary determines the inclusion of the special question
 12  6 complies with federal law and either is cost=effective or the
 12  7 petition demands inclusion.
 12  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 12  9 this subsection or include the special question as part of a
 12 10 referendum to establish a national referendum in consultation
 12 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 12 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 12 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to establish a
 12 14 national assessment.
 12 15    d.  If the secretary determines that the establishment of
 12 16 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 12 17 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 12 18 referendum conducted under paragraph "a" or a referendum
 12 19 to establish a national assessment that includes a special
 12 20 question as provided in paragraph "b", the state assessment
 12 21 shall commence on a date determined by the secretary after
 12 22 consultation with the Iowa state dairy association but
 12 23 not later than six months after the date that the special
 12 24 referendum or referendum establishing a national assessment was
 12 25 conducted.
 12 26    3.  a.  If the rate of the national assessment has been
 12 27 increased, and upon receipt of a petition of producers that
 12 28 otherwise complies with requirements to conduct an initial
 12 29 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary
 12 30 shall conduct a special referendum to determine whether to
 12 31 increase the rate of the state assessment for water quality and
 12 32 soil conservation to equal the rate of the national assessment.
 12 33    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 12 34 complies with requirements to conduct an initial referendum
 12 35 under section 179.13, subsection 1, the secretary shall include
 13  1 as part of a referendum to increase the rate of the national
 13  2 assessment, a separate special question whether to increase
 13  3 the rate of the state assessment for water quality and soil
 13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE

 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,

 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
