 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  13  4 conservation to equal the increase in the national assessment,
 13  5 if the secretary determines the inclusion of the special
 13  6 question complies with federal law and is either cost=effective
 13  7 or the petition demands inclusion.
 13  8    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 13  9 this subsection, or include the special question as part of a
 13 10 referendum to increase the national assessment, in consultation
 13 11 with the Iowa state dairy association and which may be based on
 13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  13 12 the same procedures for conducting an initial referendum under
 13 13 section 179.13, subsection 1, or a referendum to increase the
 13 14 rate of the national assessment.
 13 15    d.  If the national assessment is increased, and the
 13 16 secretary determines that an increase in the state assessment
 13 17 for water quality and soil conservation is favored by a
 13 18 majority of the producers voting in a special referendum or
 13 19 referendum to increase the rate of the national assessment,
 13 20 the rate of the state assessment shall be increased on a date
 13 21 determined by the secretary after consultation with the Iowa
 13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II

 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  13 22 state dairy association but not later than six months after the
 13 23 date that the special referendum or referendum establishing a
 13 24 national assessment was conducted.  If a special referendum or
 13 25 separate special question to increase the rate of the state
 13 26 assessment for water quality and soil conservation does not
 13 27 pass, the result of the vote shall not affect the existence or
 13 28 length of the period when the state assessment is in effect.
 13 29    4.  a.  If a state assessment for direct use is imposed,
 13 30 and upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 13 31 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 13 32 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall conduct
 13 33 a special referendum to determine whether to terminate the
 13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 31                           DIVISION II
 14 32  IOWA BEEF CATTLE PRODUCERS ASSOCIATION ==== EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE
 14 33    Sec. 13.  Section 181.1, subsection 10, Code 2017, is amended
 14 34 to read as follows:
 14 35    10.  "State assessment" means an excise tax on the sale of
 15  1 cattle  13 34 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation.
 13 35    b.  Upon receipt of a petition of producers that otherwise
 14  1 complies with requirements to conduct a special referendum
 14  2 under section 179.13, subsection 2, the secretary shall include
 14  3 as part of a special referendum to suspend or terminate the
 14  4 state assessment for direct use conducted pursuant to section
 14  5 179.13, subsection 2, a separate special question whether to
 14  6 terminate the state assessment for water quality and soil
 14  7 conservation, if the secretary determines the inclusion of the
 14  8 special question is cost=effective or the petition demands
 14  9 inclusion.
 14 10    c.  The secretary shall conduct the special referendum under
 14 11 this subsection or include the separate special question as
 14 12 part of a special referendum conducted under section 179.13,
 14 13 subsection 2, in consultation with the commission and which
 14 14 may be based on the same procedures for conducting a special
 14 15 referendum under section 179.13, subsection 2.
 14 16    d.  If the secretary determines that the termination of a
 14 17 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation is
 14 18 favored by a majority of the producers voting in a special
 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 14 19 referendum under this subsection, or a special referendum
 14 20 conducted under section 179.13, subsection 2, the state
 14 21 assessment shall terminate on a date determined by the
 14 22 secretary after consultation with the commission but not later
 14 23 than six months after the date that the special or initial
 14 24 referendum was conducted.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 25 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.
 14 26    5.  The secretary shall terminate the state assessment for
 14 27 water quality and soil and water conservation upon determining
 14 28 that the state assessment for direct use and the national
 14 29 assessment are terminated.  The secretary shall terminate the
 14 30 state assessment in an orderly manner as soon as practical.

 80  1 quality and soil conservation.
 80  2    1.  If a national assessment is imposed and upon receipt
 80  3 of a petition that otherwise complies with the requirements
 80  4 of  section 185.25, the secretary shall conduct a special
 80  5 referendum to change the rate of the state assessment for water
 80  6 quality and soil conservation to equal the combined rate of the
 80  7 national assessment and the state assessment for direct use
 80  8 as provided in section 185.21, subsection 3, paragraph "a".
 80  9 The special referendum shall be conducted in the same manner
 80 10 as a special referendum conducted pursuant to section 185.25.
 80 11 However, the special referendum may be conducted in the same
 80 12 manner and in conjunction with a referendum to change the rate
 80 13 of the national assessment, to the extent permitted by federal
 80 14 law.
 80 15    2.  If a national assessment is not imposed and upon receipt
 80 16 of a petition that otherwise complies with the requirements
 80 17 of section 185.25, the secretary shall conduct a special
 80 18 referendum to change the rate of the state assessment for
 80 19 water quality and soil conservation to equal the rate of the
 80 20 state assessment for direct use as provided in section 185.21,
 80 21 subsection 3, paragraph "b". The special referendum shall be
 80 22 conducted in the same manner as a special referendum conducted
 80 23 pursuant to section 185.25.
 80 24    3.  If a special referendum or separate special question
 80 25 to change the rate of the state assessment for water quality
 80 26 and soil conservation does not pass, the result of the vote
 80 27 shall not affect the existence or period during which the state
 80 28 assessment is in effect.

 80  6 quality and soil conservation to equal the combined rate of the

 80 13 of the national assessment, to the extent permitted by federal
 80 14 law.

 80 18 referendum to change the rate of the state assessment for
 80 19 water quality and soil conservation to equal the rate of the

 80 28 assessment is in effect.

 95 14 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 95 15 described in section 466B.51 for reasonable expenses incurred

 95 17 a state assessment for water quality and soil conservation, the

 95 20 amount to the water quality and soil conservation fund created
 95 21 in section 466B.51.  However, not more than a total of one
 95 22 hundred thousand dollars shall be paid pursuant to this section
 95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.

 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 19 appropriations addressed in section 7D.29 the payment of an
 95 20 amount to the water quality and soil conservation fund created
 95 21 in section 466B.51.  However, not more than a total of one
 95 22 hundred thousand dollars shall be paid pursuant to this section
 95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 20 amount to the water quality and soil conservation fund created
 95 21 in section 466B.51.  However, not more than a total of one
 95 22 hundred thousand dollars shall be paid pursuant to this section
 95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 21 in section 466B.51.  However, not more than a total of one
 95 22 hundred thousand dollars shall be paid pursuant to this section
 95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 22 hundred thousand dollars shall be paid pursuant to this section
 95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 23 to the fund at any one time to pay for expenses incurred in
 95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 24 conducting a referendum.
 95 25    Sec. 103.   95 25    Sec. 103.   95 26 conservation fund.
 95 27    1.  A water quality and soil conservation fund is created
 95 28 in the state treasury under the management and control of
 95 29 the division of soil conservation and water quality of the
 95 30 department of agriculture and land stewardship.
 95 31    2.  a.  The fund is composed of moneys collected from state
 95 32 assessments for water quality and soil conservation from all of
 95 33 the following commodity organizations:
 95 34    (1)  The Iowa dairy industry commission as established in
 95 35 chapter 179 or the Iowa state dairy association as recognized
 96  1 in that chapter, which shall transfer moneys collected from the
 96  2 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation as
 96  3 provided in that chapter, including section 179.5.
 96  4    (2)  The Iowa beef cattle producers association, including
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION
 97 23    Sec. 104.  NAME CHANGE TO REFERENDUM FOR DIRECT USE.  Nothing
 97 24 in this Act requires the department of agriculture and land
 97 25 stewardship or a commodity organization described in section
 97 26 466B.51, as enacted in this Act, to conduct a referendum
 97 27 because of this Act's reference to a referendum as a referendum
 97 28 for direct use.
 97 29                           EXPLANATION
 97 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 97 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 97 32    This bill relates to agricultural commodity organizations
 97 33 representing producers of that commodity that are authorized
 97 34 to impose an excise tax or "assessment" (and commonly
 97 35 referred to as a "checkoff") on the commodity when first
 98  1 sold by the producer to a first purchaser.  The goal of the
 98  2 assessment is to fund promotional activities which involve
 98  3 market development, research, and education.  The commodity
 98  4 organizations include the Iowa dairy industry commission or
 98  5 Iowa state dairy association (Code chapter 179), Iowa beef
 98  6 cattle producers association (Code chapter 181), Iowa sheep and
 98  7 wool promotion board (Code chapter 182), Iowa pork producers
 98  8 council or Iowa pork producers association (Code chapter 183A),
 98  9 Iowa egg council (Code chapter 184), the Iowa turkey marketing
 98 10 council (Code chapter 184A), the Iowa soybean association
 98 11 (Code chapter 185), and the Iowa corn promotion board (Code
 98 12 chapter 185C).  The bill requires a commodity organization to
 98 13 establish a separate state assessment for water quality and
 98 14 soil conservation, if approved by a majority of its members at
 98 15 a referendum.  The bill also requires commodity organizations
 98 16 to conduct a special referendum to increase the rate of the
 98 17 assessment for water quality and soil conservation to equal
 98 18 any increase in the assessment for direct use or national
 98 19 assessment or both. Expenses associated with conducting a
 98 20 referendum would be paid from moneys deposited into the fund
 98 21 or by the executive council if moneys in the fund were not
 98 22 adequate to cover expenses. The referendum would be conducted
 98 23 in the same manner as an initial or special referendum
 98 24 conducted by the commodity organization under its specific
 98 25 Code chapter.  The special assessment could be continued or
 98 26 terminated in the same manner as the commodity organization's
 98 27 assessment for promotional activities.  The amount of the
 98 28 state assessment would be the same as the effective rate for
 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
       LSB 1401XS (24) 87
       da/rj
 95 27    1.  A water quality and soil conservation fund is created
 95 28 in the state treasury under the management and control of
 95 29 the division of soil conservation and water quality of the
 95 30 department of agriculture and land stewardship.
 95 31    2.  a.  The fund is composed of moneys collected from state
 95 32 assessments for water quality and soil conservation from all of
 95 33 the following commodity organizations:
 95 34    (1)  The Iowa dairy industry commission as established in
 95 35 chapter 179 or the Iowa state dairy association as recognized
 96  1 in that chapter, which shall transfer moneys collected from the
 96  2 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation as
 96  3 provided in that chapter, including section 179.5.
 96  4    (2)  The Iowa beef cattle producers association, including
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.

 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.

 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION
 97 23    Sec. 104.  NAME CHANGE TO REFERENDUM FOR DIRECT USE.  Nothing
 97 24 in this Act requires the department of agriculture and land
 97 25 stewardship or a commodity organization described in section
 97 26 466B.51, as enacted in this Act, to conduct a referendum
 97 27 because of this Act's reference to a referendum as a referendum
 97 28 for direct use.
 97 29                           EXPLANATION
 97 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 97 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 97 32    This bill relates to agricultural commodity organizations
 97 33 representing producers of that commodity that are authorized
 97 34 to impose an excise tax or "assessment" (and commonly
 97 35 referred to as a "checkoff") on the commodity when first
 98  1 sold by the producer to a first purchaser.  The goal of the
 98  2 assessment is to fund promotional activities which involve
 98  3 market development, research, and education.  The commodity
 98  4 organizations include the Iowa dairy industry commission or
 98  5 Iowa state dairy association (Code chapter 179), Iowa beef
 98  6 cattle producers association (Code chapter 181), Iowa sheep and
 98  7 wool promotion board (Code chapter 182), Iowa pork producers
 98  8 council or Iowa pork producers association (Code chapter 183A),
 98  9 Iowa egg council (Code chapter 184), the Iowa turkey marketing
 98 10 council (Code chapter 184A), the Iowa soybean association
 98 11 (Code chapter 185), and the Iowa corn promotion board (Code
 98 12 chapter 185C).  The bill requires a commodity organization to
 98 13 establish a separate state assessment for water quality and
 98 14 soil conservation, if approved by a majority of its members at
 98 15 a referendum.  The bill also requires commodity organizations
 98 16 to conduct a special referendum to increase the rate of the
 98 17 assessment for water quality and soil conservation to equal
 98 18 any increase in the assessment for direct use or national
 98 19 assessment or both. Expenses associated with conducting a
 98 20 referendum would be paid from moneys deposited into the fund
 98 21 or by the executive council if moneys in the fund were not
 98 22 adequate to cover expenses. The referendum would be conducted
 98 23 in the same manner as an initial or special referendum
 98 24 conducted by the commodity organization under its specific
 98 25 Code chapter.  The special assessment could be continued or
 98 26 terminated in the same manner as the commodity organization's
 98 27 assessment for promotional activities.  The amount of the
 98 28 state assessment would be the same as the effective rate for
 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
       LSB 1401XS (24) 87
       da/rj
 95 31    2.  a.  The fund is composed of moneys collected from state
 95 32 assessments for water quality and soil conservation from all of
 95 33 the following commodity organizations:
 95 34    (1)  The Iowa dairy industry commission as established in
 95 35 chapter 179 or the Iowa state dairy association as recognized
 96  1 in that chapter, which shall transfer moneys collected from the
 96  2 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation as
 96  3 provided in that chapter, including section 179.5.
 96  4    (2)  The Iowa beef cattle producers association, including
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION

 95 35 chapter 179 or the Iowa state dairy association as recognized
 96  1 in that chapter, which shall transfer moneys collected from the
 96  2 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation as
 96  3 provided in that chapter, including section 179.5.
 96  4    (2)  The Iowa beef cattle producers association, including
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION
 97 23    Sec. 104.  NAME CHANGE TO REFERENDUM FOR DIRECT USE.  Nothing
 97 24 in this Act requires the department of agriculture and land
 97 25 stewardship or a commodity organization described in section
 97 26 466B.51, as enacted in this Act, to conduct a referendum
 97 27 because of this Act's reference to a referendum as a referendum
 97 28 for direct use.
 97 29                           EXPLANATION
 97 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 97 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 97 32    This bill relates to agricultural commodity organizations
 97 33 representing producers of that commodity that are authorized
 97 34 to impose an excise tax or "assessment" (and commonly
 97 35 referred to as a "checkoff") on the commodity when first
 98  1 sold by the producer to a first purchaser.  The goal of the
 98  2 assessment is to fund promotional activities which involve
 98  3 market development, research, and education.  The commodity
 98  4 organizations include the Iowa dairy industry commission or
 98  5 Iowa state dairy association (Code chapter 179), Iowa beef
 98  6 cattle producers association (Code chapter 181), Iowa sheep and
 98  7 wool promotion board (Code chapter 182), Iowa pork producers
 98  8 council or Iowa pork producers association (Code chapter 183A),
 98  9 Iowa egg council (Code chapter 184), the Iowa turkey marketing
 98 10 council (Code chapter 184A), the Iowa soybean association
 98 11 (Code chapter 185), and the Iowa corn promotion board (Code
 98 12 chapter 185C).  The bill requires a commodity organization to
 98 13 establish a separate state assessment for water quality and
 98 14 soil conservation, if approved by a majority of its members at
 98 15 a referendum.  The bill also requires commodity organizations
 98 16 to conduct a special referendum to increase the rate of the
 98 17 assessment for water quality and soil conservation to equal
 98 18 any increase in the assessment for direct use or national
 98 19 assessment or both. Expenses associated with conducting a
 98 20 referendum would be paid from moneys deposited into the fund
 98 21 or by the executive council if moneys in the fund were not
 98 22 adequate to cover expenses. The referendum would be conducted
 98 23 in the same manner as an initial or special referendum
 98 24 conducted by the commodity organization under its specific
 98 25 Code chapter.  The special assessment could be continued or
 98 26 terminated in the same manner as the commodity organization's
 98 27 assessment for promotional activities.  The amount of the
 98 28 state assessment would be the same as the effective rate for
 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
       LSB 1401XS (24) 87
       da/rj
 96  1 in that chapter, which shall transfer moneys collected from the
 96  2 state assessment for water quality and soil conservation as
 96  3 provided in that chapter, including section 179.5.
 96  4    (2)  The Iowa beef cattle producers association, including
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X

 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
       LSB 1401XS (24) 87
       da/rj
 96  5 its executive committee, as established in chapter 181 which
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION
 97 23    Sec. 104.  NAME CHANGE TO REFERENDUM FOR DIRECT USE.  Nothing
 97 24 in this Act requires the department of agriculture and land
 97 25 stewardship or a commodity organization described in section
 97 26 466B.51, as enacted in this Act, to conduct a referendum
 97 27 because of this Act's reference to a referendum as a referendum
 97 28 for direct use.
 97 29                           EXPLANATION
 97 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 97 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.
 97 32    This bill relates to agricultural commodity organizations
 97 33 representing producers of that commodity that are authorized
 97 34 to impose an excise tax or "assessment" (and commonly
 97 35 referred to as a "checkoff") on the commodity when first
 98  1 sold by the producer to a first purchaser.  The goal of the
 98  2 assessment is to fund promotional activities which involve
 98  3 market development, research, and education.  The commodity
 98  4 organizations include the Iowa dairy industry commission or
 98  5 Iowa state dairy association (Code chapter 179), Iowa beef
 98  6 cattle producers association (Code chapter 181), Iowa sheep and
 98  7 wool promotion board (Code chapter 182), Iowa pork producers
 98  8 council or Iowa pork producers association (Code chapter 183A),
 98  9 Iowa egg council (Code chapter 184), the Iowa turkey marketing
 98 10 council (Code chapter 184A), the Iowa soybean association
 98 11 (Code chapter 185), and the Iowa corn promotion board (Code
 98 12 chapter 185C).  The bill requires a commodity organization to
 98 13 establish a separate state assessment for water quality and
 98 14 soil conservation, if approved by a majority of its members at
 98 15 a referendum.  The bill also requires commodity organizations
 98 16 to conduct a special referendum to increase the rate of the
 98 17 assessment for water quality and soil conservation to equal
 98 18 any increase in the assessment for direct use or national
 98 19 assessment or both. Expenses associated with conducting a
 98 20 referendum would be paid from moneys deposited into the fund
 98 21 or by the executive council if moneys in the fund were not
 98 22 adequate to cover expenses. The referendum would be conducted
 98 23 in the same manner as an initial or special referendum
 98 24 conducted by the commodity organization under its specific
 98 25 Code chapter.  The special assessment could be continued or
 98 26 terminated in the same manner as the commodity organization's
 98 27 assessment for promotional activities.  The amount of the
 98 28 state assessment would be the same as the effective rate for
 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
       LSB 1401XS (24) 87
       da/rj
 96  6 shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96  7 chapter, including section 181.13.
 96  8    (3)  The Iowa sheep and wool promotion board established
 96  9 pursuant to chapter 182 which shall transfer the moneys to the
 96 10 fund as provided in that chapter, including section 182.18.
 96 11    (4)  The Iowa pork producers council as established in
 96 12 chapter 183A, or the Iowa pork producers association as
 96 13 recognized in that chapter, which shall transfer the moneys to
 96 14 the fund as provided in that chapter, including section 183A.7.
 96 15    (5)  The Iowa egg council as established in chapter 184
 96 16 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in that
 96 17 chapter, including section 184.13.
 96 18    (6)  The Iowa turkey marketing council as established in
 96 19 chapter 184A which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as
 96 20 provided in that chapter, including section 184A.4.
 96 21    (7)  The Iowa soybean association as recognized in chapter
 96 22 185 which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 23 that chapter, including section 185.26.
 96 24    (8)  The Iowa corn promotion board as established in  chapter
 96 25 185C which shall transfer the moneys to the fund as provided in
 96 26 that chapter, including section 185C.26.
 96 27    b.  The fund may include any other moneys available to
 96 28 and obtained or accepted by the division from the federal
 96 29 government or private sources for placement in the fund.
 96 30    3.  Moneys in the fund shall be expended by the division to
 96 31 support programs and projects administered by the division to
 96 32 improve the state's watersheds and surface waters, including
 96 33 but not limited to projects associated with the water quality
 96 34 initiative established pursuant to section 466B.42.  Moneys
 96 35 in the fund shall also be used to support soil conservation
 97  1 and watershed protection, the installation of conservation
 97  2 practices and watershed protection improvements as provided in
 97  3 chapters 161A, 161C, 461A, 466, and 466A.
 97  4    4.  The division shall remit refunds of moneys to persons
 97  5 who have paid state assessments to a commodity organization as
 97  6 described in subsection 2, if the application for a refund has
 97  7 been approved by the commodity organization and submitted to
 97  8 the division as required by the division.
 97  9    5.  The division shall reimburse the department of
 97 10 agriculture and land stewardship or a commodity organization
 97 11 for all reasonable costs of conducting a referendum to
 97 12 determine if a state assessment for water quality and soil
 97 13 conservation will be established, continued, or terminated.
 97 14 The department shall apply to the executive council if
 97 15 necessary to receive moneys required to pay for reasonable
 97 16 costs of conducting a referendum as provided in section 7D.10B.
 97 17    6.  Notwithstanding section 8.33, moneys in the fund shall
 97 18 not revert. Notwithstanding section 12C.7, subsection 2,
 97 19 interest or earnings on moneys in the fund shall be credited
 97 20 to the fund.
 97 21                           DIVISION X
 97 22                         ADMINISTRATION
 97 23    Sec. 104.  NAME CHANGE TO REFERENDUM FOR DIRECT USE.  Nothing
 97 24 in this Act requires the department of agriculture and land
 97 25 stewardship or a commodity organization described in section
 97 26 466B.51, as enacted in this Act, to conduct a referendum
 97 27 because of this Act's reference to a referendum as a referendum
 97 28 for direct use.

 97 30 The inclusion of this explanation does not constitute agreement with
 97 31 the explanation's substance by the members of the general assembly.

 97 33 representing producers of that commodity that are authorized
 97 34 to impose an excise tax or "assessment" (and commonly
 97 35 referred to as a "checkoff") on the commodity when first
 98  1 sold by the producer to a first purchaser.  The goal of the
 98  2 assessment is to fund promotional activities which involve
 98  3 market development, research, and education.  The commodity
 98  4 organizations include the Iowa dairy industry commission or
 98  5 Iowa state dairy association (Code chapter 179), Iowa beef
 98  6 cattle producers association (Code chapter 181), Iowa sheep and
 98  7 wool promotion board (Code chapter 182), Iowa pork producers
 98  8 council or Iowa pork producers association (Code chapter 183A),
 98  9 Iowa egg council (Code chapter 184), the Iowa turkey marketing
 98 10 council (Code chapter 184A), the Iowa soybean association
 98 11 (Code chapter 185), and the Iowa corn promotion board (Code
 98 12 chapter 185C).  The bill requires a commodity organization to

 98 14 soil conservation, if approved by a majority of its members at
 98 15 a referendum.  The bill also requires commodity organizations
 98 16 to conduct a special referendum to increase the rate of the
 98 17 assessment for water quality and soil conservation to equal
 98 18 any increase in the assessment for direct use or national
 98 19 assessment or both. Expenses associated with conducting a
 98 20 referendum would be paid from moneys deposited into the fund
 98 21 or by the executive council if moneys in the fund were not
 98 22 adequate to cover expenses. The referendum would be conducted
 98 23 in the same manner as an initial or special referendum
 98 24 conducted by the commodity organization under its specific
 98 25 Code chapter.  The special assessment could be continued or
 98 26 terminated in the same manner as the commodity organization's
 98 27 assessment for promotional activities.  The amount of the
 98 28 state assessment would be the same as the effective rate for
 98 29 the promotional assessment imposed under state or federal law.
 98 30 Moneys from the state assessment would be collected by the
 98 31 commodity organization and transferred to the division of soil
 98 32 conservation and water quality of the department of agriculture
 98 33 and land stewardship for purposes of supporting existing water
 98 34 quality programs and projects or soil conservation programs
 98 35 and projects. The bill authorizes the payment of refunds to
 99  1 producers who were eligible to receive refunds from their
 99  2 commodity organization and for the payment of expenses incurred
 99  3 by conducting a referendum to impose the state assessment.
